definition: to roll/to wander around/to appear repeatedly
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
long or drawn out/remote in time or space/leisurely/to swing/pensive/worried

sentences.english: “He was just wandering around, ” the white coat answered.
sentences.chinese: “他刚才在到处转悠来着，”穿白大衣的人说。

sentences.english: You walked about my seat, playing with blue plums.
sentences.chinese: 你在我凳子边上转悠，和蓝梅一块玩儿。

sentences.english: This man does hang about the house.
sentences.chinese: 这个人常在我家周围转悠。

sentences.english: He hung about the entrance all day, hoping for a chance to speak to the director.
sentences.chinese: 他在门口转悠了一整天，企望有机会同局长谈谈。

sentences.english: On my first day I wandered around for twenty minutes before I could find the copy room.
sentences.chinese: 第一天上班我转悠了20分钟才找到复印室在哪里。

sentences.english: Originally think that I got news to specially go to in garden and turn leisurely today yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 原来以为我是昨日得了消息今日特地去园子里转悠。

sentences.english: Yesterday we tooted around Nottingham in our car.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我们开着车在诺丁汉转悠。

sentences.english: Yesterday we tootled around Nottingham in our car.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我们开着车在诺丁汉转悠。

sentences.english: I walked around for a couple days. Eventually, I flew home.
sentences.chinese: 我就那么转悠了几天，最后，就飞回去了。

sentences.english: A whole have their own like a gyroscope, around the day and night.
sentences.chinese: 一个个都把自己整得像个陀螺，没日没夜的转悠。

sentences.english: Do you not see how the blackbird Walks around the feet Of the women about you?
sentences.chinese: 您没看见黑鹂么？它正在你身旁女人的脚边转悠。

definition: to stroll/to go for a walk
to swing/to sway/to wobble/to hang around/to hover around
to rove around/to run around in circles/to walk back and forth
to go sightseeing/to spend one's leisure time wandering around
to look in all directions (idiom)/to glance around
to roam around/to have a stroll
